service.name: Vercel
service.description: Full-stack platform for frontend with serverless functions, edge runtime, and automatic CI/CD

costModel.assumptions: Hobby plan is free forever for personal projects. Pro plan starts at $20/mo + additional usage; estimate assumes low-to-moderate usage.

service.name: Cloudflare CDN
service.description: Global content delivery network with 330+ data centers, unmetered DDoS protection, and edge caching

costModel.assumptions: CDN included in all plans. Free tier available. Pro at $20/mo (annual), Business at $200/mo (annual). CDN usage does not incur per-GB fees; higher tiers add security and performance features.

service.name: Cloudflare R2
service.description: S3-compatible object storage with zero egress fees and simple per-GB and per-request pricing

costModel.assumptions: Pricing includes $0.015/GB-month for Standard storage and $0.01/GB-month for Infrequent Access. Class A operations cost $4.50 per million (Standard) or $9.00 per million (IA). Class B operations cost $0.36 per million (Standard) or $0.90 per million (IA). Infrequent Access has a 30-day minimum storage duration and $0.01/GB retrieval fee. Egress to the Internet is free. Free tier includes 10GB storage, 1M Class A ops, and 10M Class B ops per month.

service.name: AWS API Gateway
service.description: Fully managed service for building, deploying, and securing REST, HTTP, and WebSocket APIs at scale

costModel.assumptions: Free tier includes 1M REST calls, 1M HTTP calls, 1M WebSocket messages, and 750k connection minutes per month for 12 months. New AWS accounts (after July 2025) also receive $200 in service credits. HTTP APIs: $1.00 per million requests (first 300M). REST APIs: tiered at $3.50 per million (first 333M), $2.80 (next 667M), $2.38 (next 19B). WebSocket APIs: $1.00 per million messages + $0.25 per million connection minutes. Optional caching adds hourly charges. API Gateway Portals are a separate product with monthly fees.

service.name: AWS Application Load Balancer
service.description: Layer 7 load balancer for HTTP/HTTPS traffic with advanced routing, SSL termination, and health checks

costModel.assumptions: ALB pricing includes $0.0225 per ALB-hour plus $0.008 per LCU-hour. LCUs are based on the highest of new connections, active connections, processed bytes (note: 1 LCU = 1GB/hr for EC2 targets, 0.4GB/hr for Lambda targets), or rule evaluations (first 10 rules free). Free tier includes 750 ALB hours and 15 LCUs per month for new AWS accounts. Data transfer and public IPv4 addresses are billed separately.

service.name: AWS Lambda
service.description: Serverless compute service that runs code in response to events

costModel.assumptions: Free tier includes 1M requests and 400k GB-seconds per month. Pricing scales with request count, memory size, and execution duration. Additional charges apply for Provisioned Concurrency, ephemeral storage, SnapStart, and data transfer.

service.name: AWS Fargate
service.description: Serverless compute engine for containers, billed per vCPU-second, GB-second, and storage

costModel.assumptions: Pricing is based on vCPU-seconds, GB-seconds, and additional ephemeral storage beyond the included 20GB. Linux tasks have a 1-minute minimum billing. Estimate assumes 0.25–2 vCPU tasks, either intermittent jobs or small numbers of long-running services.

service.name: AWS ElastiCache Redis
service.description: Fully managed Redis-compatible in-memory cache with support for serverless, on-demand nodes, clustering, and data tiering

costModel.assumptions: Free Tier: For sign-ups before July 15, 2025, includes 750 hrs of cache.t3.micro. For sign-ups after, includes $100 AWS credits. Pricing varies by engine (Valkey, Redis OSS, Memcached) and model: Serverless (GB-hours + ECPUs), On-demand node hours, Reserved Nodes (1-3 year commitments), and Database Savings Plans. Valkey Serverless has a 100 MB minimum; others have 1 GB. Backup storage is $0.085/GB/month.

service.name: AWS SQS
service.description: Fully managed message queue service for decoupling and scaling microservices

costModel.assumptions: Free tier includes 1M requests per month across all regions (except GovCloud). Pricing for Standard and FIFO queues is tiered based on monthly volume (e.g., in US East (Ohio): Standard: $0.40, $0.30, $0.24 per million; FIFO: $0.50, $0.40, $0.35 per million). Fair queues add a $0.10 per million request surcharge on applicable Standard queue requests. Each 64KB of payload counts as one request, and a single API call can batch up to 10 messages.

service.name: AWS Secrets Manager
service.description: Securely store, rotate, and manage API keys, database credentials, and other secrets

costModel.assumptions: Pricing is $0.40 per secret per month (prorated hourly) and $0.05 per 10,000 API calls. New AWS accounts (after July 15, 2025) receive up to $200 in AWS Free Tier service credits usable for Secrets Manager. Replica secrets are billed separately. No charge for creating new secret versions.

service.name: Clerk
service.description: User management and authentication with pre-built UI components, MFA, organizations, and enterprise SSO

costModel.assumptions: Free tier includes 10,000 monthly active users (MAUs) and 100 monthly active organizations (MAOs). Pro plan starts at $25/mo and charges $0.02 per additional MAU and $1 per additional MAO. Key add-ons are available at $100/mo each: Enhanced Authentication (MFA, Enterprise SSO), Enhanced Administration (user impersonation, audit logs), and Enhanced Organizations (verified domains, custom roles). Additional dashboard seats cost $10/mo each.

service.name: Neon
service.description: Serverless Postgres with instant branching, autoscaling, scale-to-zero, and bottomless storage

costModel.assumptions: Free plan includes 100 CU-hours per project, 0.5 GB storage, 100 projects, 10 branches, autoscaling, read replicas, and scale-to-zero. Launch plan charges $0.106 per CU-hour with up to 16 CUs and 64 GB RAM, $0.35/GB-month storage, $0.20/GB-month PITR, and 100 GB included egress. Scale plan charges $0.222 per CU-hour with up to 56 CUs and 224 GB RAM, 30-day PITR, private networking, metrics/logs export, and 99.95% SLA.

service.name: MongoDB Atlas
service.description: Fully managed multi-cloud MongoDB database with automatic scaling, backups, vector search, and global distribution

costModel.assumptions: Three main tiers. **Free (M0)**: 512MB storage, 100 ops/sec limit, shared resources. **Flex**: $0.011/hour base (~$8/month), scales with ops/sec (100-500), capped at $30/month. **Dedicated (M10+)**: Starts at $0.08/hour (M10). Costs increase significantly per tier (e.g., M300 ~$21.85/hour). Storage is tier-specific (e.g., M10: 10-128GB, M700: 4TB). Additional major costs: Data transfer (egress), backup storage ($0.08-$0.65/GB-month), support plans, and add-ons (Search nodes, etc.).

service.name: Stripe
service.description: Complete payment platform with APIs for online payments, subscriptions, invoicing, and financial services

costModel.assumptions: U.S. pricing: 2.9% + 30¢ for domestic cards, +1.5% for international cards, +1% if currency conversion is required. ACH Direct Debit at 0.8% with a $5 cap. Terminal in‑person payments at 2.7% + 5¢. Additional products such as Billing, Invoicing, Tax, Sigma, and Data Pipeline have separate usage‑based pricing. Costs scale linearly with transaction volume.

service.name: Resend
service.description: Modern email API for developers with templates, analytics, multi-region delivery, and reliable infrastructure

costModel.assumptions: Free tier includes 3,000 emails/month and 100 emails/day. Pro plan starts at $35/month for 100,000 emails with $0.90 per 1,000 extra. Scale plan starts at $90/month and scales with volume: $160 for 200k, $350 for 500k, $650 for 1M, $825 for 1.5M, $1,150 for 2.5M, with decreasing overage rates down to $0.46 per 1,000. Enterprise recommended above 3M emails with custom pricing.

service.name: Pusher Channels
service.description: Real-time WebSocket communication platform for building live features like chat, notifications, collaboration, and multiplayer experiences

costModel.assumptions: Free Sandbox plan includes 200k messages/day and 100 concurrent connections. Paid plans scale by messages/day and concurrent connections: Startup ($49/mo for 1M messages/day and 500 connections), Pro ($99/mo for 4M messages/day and 2,000 connections), Business ($299/mo for 10M messages/day and 5,000 connections), Premium ($499/mo for 20M messages/day and 10,000 connections), Growth ($699/mo for 40M messages/day and 15,000 connections), Plus ($899/mo for 60M messages/day and 20,000 connections), Growth Plus ($1,199/mo for 90M messages/day and 30,000 connections). Enterprise tier supports up to 10M concurrent connections and 100B+ messages/day. Overages handled with soft limits and upgrade prompts. Support tiers vary from Standard to Premium to Priority.

service.name: Inngest
service.description: Event-driven durable workflow engine with automatic retries, scheduling, fan-out patterns, and visual debugging

costModel.assumptions: Hobby plan includes 50k executions/month, 100k events/month, 5 concurrency, 3 workers, and 3 users. Pro plan includes 1M executions/month, 5M events/month, 100 concurrency, and 20 workers, with overages at $50 per 1M executions and $0.50 per 1M events. Enterprise offers custom pricing with higher limits, dedicated support, and compliance options. Executions include every durable function run or step. Events include all received/processed events. Concurrency and workers scale independently.

service.name: Sentry
service.description: Application monitoring and error tracking with real-time alerts, performance monitoring, release tracking, and detailed stack traces

costModel.assumptions: Developer plan includes 5k errors, 5GB logs, 5M spans, 50 replays, 1 uptime monitor, 1 cron monitor, and 1 user. Team plan is $26/mo (annual) with 50k errors, 5GB logs, 5M spans, 50 replays, unlimited users, and 20 metric alerts. Business plan is $80/mo (annual) with Insights, 90-day lookback, unlimited dashboards, anomaly detection, and SAML/SCIM. Pay-as-you-go add-ons include logs ($0.50/GB), cron monitors ($0.78 each), uptime alerts ($1 each), UI profiling ($0.25/hr), continuous profiling ($0.0315/hr), and Session Replay beyond included quotas.

service.name: PostHog
service.description: Open-source product analytics platform with event tracking, session replay, feature flags, A/B testing, surveys, data pipelines, and AI tooling

costModel.assumptions: Free tier includes: 1M analytics events, 5K session replays, 1M feature flag requests, 1.5K survey responses, 1M data warehouse rows, 10K pipeline trigger events, 100K LLM analytics events, 2K PostHog AI credits, 10K workflow emails, and 10K workflow dispatches per month. Usage-based pricing applies after free tier with volume discounts: analytics from $0.00005/event, session replay from $0.005/recording, feature flags from $0.0001/request, surveys from $0.10/response, data warehouse from $0.000015/row, pipelines from $0.0005/trigger event, error tracking from $0.00037/exception, workflows from $0.003/email. Self-hosted option is MIT-licensed and free aside from infrastructure.

service.name: AWS Fargate
service.description: Serverless compute engine for containers, billed per vCPU-second, GB-second, and storage

costModel.assumptions: Pricing is based on vCPU-seconds, GB-seconds, and additional ephemeral storage beyond the included 20GB. Linux tasks have a 1-minute minimum billing. Estimate assumes 0.25–2 vCPU tasks, either intermittent jobs or small numbers of long-running services.
